tool_description:
Yes, its the brand new instagtram API, updated to 2024 issues.
All necessary endpoints. If smth missed: t.me/apialien
Deep, rapid, creative. Followers, media, etc.
name: instagram || 2024, new
title: instagram || 2024, new

api_list.name: search hashtag
api_list.description: search hashtag if you really need it, LOL

api_list.name: Search user
info :: by shortcode
api_list.description: Getting post info, with only a shortcode (I.e.:C3wFeB9pMYc)
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://instagram-2024-new.p.rapidapi.com/api/instagram/posts/info/C3wFeB9pMYc/code"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "instagram-2024-new.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://instagram-2024-new.p.rapidapi.com/api/instagram/posts/info/{code}/code"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "instagram-2024-new.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: about (unique!!!) :: by user_id
api_list.description:
This one is really interesting 

1) Country 
2) 1st month + year in Instagram (sign up)
3) Verify status
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://instagram-2024-new.p.rapidapi.com/api/instagram/users/25025320/about"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "instagram-2024-new.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://instagram-2024-new.p.rapidapi.com/api/instagram/users/{id}/about"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "instagram-2024-new.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: clips :: by user_id
posts :: by user_id
api_list.description:
All you need is posts…

with user_id retrieving:  
12 last post + cursor position 
post info (90 parameters)
 user_info (10 parameters)

api_list.name: info :: by username
api_list.description:
Returns basic user info, by username

Use "username" to get detailed user info (if originally provided), such as:
- Followers/Follows count
- Media count
- Birthdate 
- Links in bio
- Phone/email
- User_id
- Facebook id / ads id

and much more ->
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://instagram-2024-new.p.rapidapi.com/api/instagram/users/info/instagram/username"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "instagram-2024-new.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://instagram-2024-new.p.rapidapi.com/api/instagram/users/info/{username}/username"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "instagram-2024-new.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: info :: by user_id
api_list.description:
Returns basic user info, by user_id

Use "user_id" (pk) to get detailed user info (if originally provided), such as:
- Followers/Follows count
- Media count
- Birthdate 
- Links in bio
- Phone/email
- Username
- Facebook id / ads id

and much more ->
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://instagram-2024-new.p.rapidapi.com/api/instagram/users/info/25025320/id"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "instagram-2024-new.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://instagram-2024-new.p.rapidapi.com/api/instagram/users/info/{user_id}/id"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "instagram-2024-new.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
